response_parsed.title: Securing Edge Runtimes with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a comprehensive overview of how to secure edge runtimes using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: Leverage built-in security features such as ORM (Object-Relational Mapper) and ORM sessions for database operations.
Utilize OAuth2 authentication and authorization with OpenID Connect, JWT (JSON Web Tokens), or any other supported scheme.
Implement rate limiting to control the number of requests per user or per IP address.
Enable HTTPS by configuring SSL/TLS certificates for secure data transmission.
Use Dependency Injection to separate security concerns and ensure that security checks are applied consistently across the application.

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, Depends
app = FastAPI()
# Define a security dependency for OAuth2 authentication.
security = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer(tokenUrl='token'))

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for utilizing the latest features and improvements in FastAPI.
FastAPI version 0.76.0 and above includes significant updates related to security enhancements.
caveats: It's crucial to test your application thoroughly, especially after implementing new security measures.
Always follow best practices for securing web applications when using FastAPI or any other framework.
